specs.title: Build codex.html — Stoic content hub

It uses the shared nav/footer from C-010, the C-006 design token set, and extends the monolith design language. Six article cards in a 3-column grid. Branded placeholder content — no lorem ipsum. Vitalik writes all copy in SOLEINVICTVS voice.

specs.acceptance_criteria: codex.html renders in browser. Shared nav shows 4 links, The Codex link is gold (active state via data-page='codex'). Six article cards render in 3-column grid. All card content is in SOLEINVICTVS brand voice — no lorem ipsum. Quote section and newsletter section render identically to index.html equivalents. Mobile at 375px shows 1-column card stack, nav links hidden. Page title in browser tab reads 'The Codex — SOLEINVICTVS'.
edge_cases: The Codex nav link on codex.html itself should be highlighted gold via body[data-page='codex'] .nav-links a[href='codex.html'] { color: var(--gold); } — verify this fires.
All card CTAs link to href='#' — individual article pages are E-006 scope. Do not create article files.
Excerpt text must be exactly 2 sentences per card — no longer. Brand voice: direct, no hustle language.
Newsletter form submit shows 'Enlisted ✦' confirmation — same JS behavior as index.html.

Build page header, article grid (6 cards), quote section, newsletter section. 5. Write all placeholder card copy in brand voice. 6. Copy scroll reveal JS. 7. Test responsive.
risks_and_notes: The primary risk is copy quality — Elena specified 'no lorem ipsum, Vitalik writes branded content.' Vitalik must write excerpts that sound like real SOLEINVICTVS essays. If copy feels weak, operator can swap it without layout changes. Architectural risk is zero — this is a straightforward static page.
message_to_operator: After C-011 ships, the Codex page is live with placeholder cards. You can swap in real article content by editing the card titles and excerpts in the HTML. Individual article pages are E-006 scope.
message_to_vitalik:
BUILD ORDER:
1. Create soleinvictvs-web/codex.html from scratch.
2. Head: copy @font-face comment block from virtue-audit.html (same structure), Google Fonts URL with all 4 families, C-006 :root tokens.
3. Body: data-page='codex'.
4. Nav: shared canonical nav HTML (position:fixed — this is a content page, not a tool page).
5. Page header section: 'THE CODEX' eyebrow, h1 title, gold rule, sub text. Top padding 14rem to clear fixed nav.
6. Article grid: 6 cards, 3-col grid. Write all 6 card titles and 2-sentence excerpts in SOLEINVICTVS brand voice. Each excerpt must sound like a real essay teaser. No lorem ipsum. Direct, philosophical tone.
7. Quote section: Seneca quote, same markup pattern as index.html.
8. Newsletter section: copy exact markup and JS from index.html.
9. Footer: shared canonical footer HTML.
10. JS: copy scroll reveal + handleSignup from index.html.

WATCH OUT FOR:
- Nav must be position:fixed (content page). Top padding on page-header must be large enough (14rem) to clear the fixed nav on desktop.
- data-page='codex' activates the Codex nav link gold highlight — verify this fires.
- Excerpt text: exactly 2 sentences. Direct voice. No hyphens in body text. No hustle language.

DO NOT:
- Create individual article pages — all card hrefs stay at '#'.
- Copy any markup from the old codex.html — it uses a different design system.

DONE WHEN:
- Page renders with 6 article cards in brand voice.
- Nav shows 'The Codex' in gold (active state).
- Mobile shows 1-column layout.
- Newsletter form works (shows 'Enlisted ✦' on submit).
